segments.source_content:
---
slug: /230
title: "This Week In React #230: Next.js, Turbopack, Rspack, Activity, RSC, oRPC, tweakcn | Expo, Fantom, FlashList, SVG, Tracy, New Arch, Radon | TC39, Temporal, Zod, Bare, Rolldown, CSS Functions"
authors: [slorber]
date: 04-16-2025
---
Hi everyone!

This week we have a great Next.js release with significant build speed improvements. I'm also quite excited to see the activity around the upcoming React `<Activity>` component. Many great community blog posts to read too!

translations.fr: Cette semaine, nous avons une excellente version de Next.js avec des amÃ©liorations significatives de la vitesse de build. Je suis Ã©galement trÃ¨s enthousiaste de voir l'activitÃ© autour du futur composant React `<Activity>`. De nombreux articles passionnants de la communautÃ© Ã  lire aussi !
translations.en: Cette semaine, nous avons une superbe version de Next.js avec des amÃ©liorations significatives de la vitesse de build. Je suis Ã©galement trÃ¨s enthousiaste de voir l'activitÃ© autour du prochain composant React `<Activity>`. Beaucoup d'excellents articles de blog communautaires Ã  lire Ã©galement !

segments.source_content: React Native also has great releases with the new Expo SDK in beta, and the next version of FlashList in alpha.

translations.fr: React Native propose Ã©galement de belles sorties avec la nouvelle version bÃªta d'Expo SDK et la prochaine version alpha de FlashList.
translations.en: React Native propose Ã©galement de belles versions avec le nouveau SDK Expo en version bÃªta et la prochaine version de FlashList en alpha.

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![Product management is broken. Engineers can fix it](/emails/issues/230/posthog.jpg)](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)

translations.fr: [![La gestion de produit est cassÃ©e. Les ingÃ©nieurs peuvent la rÃ©parer](/emails/issues/230/posthog.jpg)](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)
translations.en: [![La gestion de produit est cassÃ©e. Les ingÃ©nieurs peuvent la rÃ©parer](/emails/issues/230/posthog.jpg)](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)

segments.source_content: **[Product management is broken. Engineers can fix it](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)**

translations.fr: **[La gestion de produit est cassÃ©e. Les ingÃ©nieurs peuvent la rÃ©parer](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)**
translations.en: **[La gestion de produit est cassÃ©e. Les ingÃ©nieurs peuvent la rÃ©parer](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16)**

segments.source_content: When [PostHog](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16-ph) started, they were adamant they wouldÂ **neverÂ hire a product manager**. They wanted engineers to wrestle with hard product problems. Product managers would just get in the way.

translations.fr: Lorsque [PostHog](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16-ph) a commencÃ©, ils Ã©taient catÃ©goriques : ils n'embaucheraient **jamais** de chef de produit. Ils voulaient que les ingÃ©nieurs affrontent les problÃ¨mes complexes du produit. Les chefs de produit ne feraient que gÃªner.
translations.en: Lorsque [PostHog](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16-ph) a dÃ©marrÃ©, ils Ã©taient catÃ©goriques : ils **n'embaucheraient jamais de chef de produit**. Ils voulaient que les ingÃ©nieurs affrontent les problÃ¨mes produits complexes. Les chefs de produit ne feraient que gÃªner.

segments.source_content: They were (partially) wrong. They need product managers and couldnâ€™t have shipped 8+ products or hit their revenue goals without them.

translations.fr: Ils avaient (en partie) tort. Ils ont besoin de chefs de produit et n'auraient pas pu livrer 8+ produits ni atteindre leurs objectifs de revenus sans eux.
translations.en: Ils avaient (partiellement) tort. Ils ont besoin de chefs de produit et n'auraient pas pu livrer 8+ produits ou atteindre leurs objectifs de revenus sans eux.

segments.source_content: What was needed was a **redefinition of how PMs and engineers work together**, optimized for speed and autonomy. [This post shares their exact playbook](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16).

translations.fr: Ce qu'il fallait, c'Ã©tait une **redÃ©finition de la collaboration entre chefs de produit et ingÃ©nieurs**, optimisÃ©e pour la vitesse et l'autonomie. [Cet article partage leur mÃ©thode exacte](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16).
translations.en: Ce qu'il fallait, c'Ã©tait une **redÃ©finition de la collaboration entre PM et ingÃ©nieurs**, optimisÃ©e pour la vitesse et l'autonomie. [Cet article partage leur mÃ©thode exacte](https://go.posthog.com/twir-apr16).

segments.source_content: ## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Next.js 15.3](/emails/issues/230/nextjs.jpg)](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-3)
**[Next.js 15.3](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-3)**
A new minor version of Next.js is out, with highlights:

translations.fr: Une nouvelle version mineure de Next.js est disponible, avec comme points forts :
translations.en: Une nouvelle version mineure de Next.js est disponible, avec les points forts :

segments.source_content:
- Turbopack for builds (alpha): Faster production builds passing 8000+ tests (99%)
- Community support for Rspack (experimental): Alternative bundler with Webpack compatibility
- Client Instrumentation hook: Early monitoring and analytics setup
- Navigation hooks: Control routing with `onNavigate` and `useLinkStatus`
- TypeScript plugin improvements: Improved support for large codebases

translations.fr:
- Turbopack pour les builds (alpha) : Des builds de production plus rapides passant 8000+ tests (99%)
- Support communautaire pour Rspack (expÃ©rimental) : Bundler alternatif compatible Webpack
- Hook Client Instrumentation : Configuration avancÃ©e du monitoring et des analytics
- Hooks de navigation : ContrÃ´le du routage avec `onNavigate` et `useLinkStatus`
- AmÃ©liorations du plugin TypeScript : Meilleure prise en charge des gros codebases
translations.en:
- Turbopack pour les builds (alpha) : Des builds de production plus rapides passant 8000+ tests (99%)
- Support communautaire pour Rspack (expÃ©rimental) : Bundler alternatif compatible Webpack
- Hook d'instrumentation client : Configuration prÃ©coce de la surveillance et de l'analyse
- Hooks de navigation : ContrÃ´le du routage avec `onNavigate` et `useLinkStatus`
- AmÃ©liorations du plugin TypeScript : Meilleure prise en charge des grandes bases de code

segments.source_content: Itâ€™s great to see Next.js improving with faster bundling with Turbopack for builds, and opening up to Rspack as an alternative to Webpack. Both have different tradeoffs and use cases.

translations.fr: C'est formidable de voir Next.js s'amÃ©liorer avec un bundling plus rapide via Turbopack pour les builds, et s'ouvrir Ã  Rspack comme alternative Ã  Webpack. Les deux ont des compromis et cas d'usage diffÃ©rents.
translations.en: C'est formidable de voir Next.js s'amÃ©liorer avec un bundling plus rapide via Turbopack pour les builds, et s'ouvrir Ã  Rspack comme alternative Ã  Webpack. Les deux prÃ©sentent des compromis et des cas d'utilisation diffÃ©rents.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Bit - A build system framework for development of composable software. Support NodeJS, React apps (with Vite), NextJS, and modern stack.](https://bit.dev/?utm_source=ThisWeekInReact&utm_id=8&utm_medium=newsletter)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Types PR \- `unstable_Activity`](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/72454): Thereâ€™s a lot of `<Activity>` activity lately, including TypeScript typedefs added. This upcoming component, previously named `<Offscreen>`, has been [mentioned in React Labs updates since 2022](https://react.dev/blog/2022/06/15/react-labs-what-we-have-been-working-on-june-2022#offscreen), and may soon be ready for prime time? This low-level primitive is particularly exciting for frameworks to fully leverage Concurrent React.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- Experimental bfcache \- Restore state with `<Activity>`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/77992): Unsurprisingly, Next.js starts experimenting with the `<Activity>` component above, by implementing a back/forward cache feature that allows pressing the browser back button to instantly transition to the previous page while restoring its former React state. In the future, Next.js (and other React/RN frameworks too) will likely implement speculative pre-rendering: React could start rendering a target page as soon as you hover a link, even before you click it.
- ğŸ‘€ [React Core PR \- Add Suspensey Images behind a flag](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/32819): An upcoming React feature could help ensure all images have loaded before transitioning to a new page. The rollout plan is still unclear: it might come in a minor or major.
- ğŸ“œ [JSX Over The Wire](https://overreacted.io/jsx-over-the-wire/): Dan Abramov explains why you might want your API to send JSX back across the wire, through 3 different stories. The alternative could be to maintain parallel Component and ViewModel trees in both your client app and REST API. He also shares the some historical bits and technologies that led to the creation of the Server Components.
- ğŸ“œ [Toast messages in React Server Components](https://buildui.com/posts/toast-messages-in-react-server-components): Shows how to trigger the display of toast messages from Next.js Server Actions using server cookies. This technique can be used for other kinds of flash messages.
- ğŸ“œ [Memoizing components in React: a case for useMemo](https://gabrielpichot.fr/blog/memoizing-components-in-react-a-case-for-usememo/): This interactive article argues most `React.memo` can be replaced by `useMemo`, and itâ€™s closer to what the React Compiler is doing.
- ğŸ“œ [Avoid the State Synchronization Trap](https://ondrejvelisek.github.io/avoid-state-synchronization-trap/): This interactive article highlights 4 different ways to synchronize distinct React states and their tradeoffs so that what gets rendered is consistent.
- ğŸ“œ [The new Cookie Store API](https://fotis.xyz/posts/the-new-cookie-store-api/): And how you could integrate this not-widely-supported API in React apps as a progressive enhancement.
- ğŸ“œ [Building Reusable Components with React 19 Actions](https://aurorascharff.no/posts/building-reusable-components-with-react19-actions/)
- ğŸ“œ [Scale Your Project with Layered React Structure](https://playfulprogramming.com/posts/layered-react-structure)
- ğŸ“œ [View Transition API and its Integration in NextJS](https://www.premieroctet.com/blog/en/view-transition-api-in-next-js-and-react)
- ğŸ“œ [Lazy load SVG icons with \<use/\> in React.js](https://www.jeantinland.com/blog/lazy-load-svg-icons-with-use-react-js/)
- ğŸ’¸ [Guide: Integrate Clerk with your Lovable application. Bonus feature add-ons for B2B, Waitlist, custom domain and more](https://go.clerk.com/EbcUjrv)
- ğŸ“¦ [oRPC 1.0 \- Typesafe APIs Made Simple](https://orpc.unnoq.com/blog/v1-announcement): An interesting alternative to tRPC, ts-rest & next-safe-action that comes with React bindings, framework integrations and Server Actions support.
- ğŸ“¦ [tweakcn \- A visual no-code editor for shadcn/ui components](https://github.com/jnsahaj/tweakcn): A convenient tool to create a custom shadcn/ui theme, or use a pre-built one.
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro 5.7 \- SVG Components, Sessions API, Config imports, experimental Fonts API](https://astro.build/blog/astro-570/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Aria release \- Custom calendars, collections improvements, smaller bundle size](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2025-04-11.html)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington \- tRPC v11 with TanStack Query on TanStack Start\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dLUyPLbvdY0)
- ğŸ¥ [Theo â€“ Why is Next.js so slow?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mMQCLQTky34)
- ğŸ¥ [Web Dev Simplified \- How I Recreated TanStack Router From Scratch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7uUWoS1Zro)

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

- ğŸ’¸ [WithFrame - Pre-Built React Native Templates](https://withfra.me)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Native Fantom](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/blob/main/packages/react-native-fantom/__docs__/README.md): A new experimental integration testing and benchmarking tool is being actively worked on. Itâ€™s a Jest test runner that runs C++ parts of RN, enabling to test things such as shadow nodes, layout, events, scheduling, and C++ state updates. This tool is primarily useful for testing the internals of React Native, but its scope may extend to testing library/product code in the future.
- ğŸ“– [Advanced Topics on Native Modules Development](https://reactnative.dev/docs/the-new-architecture/advanced-topics-modules) and [Advanced Topics on Native Components Development](https://reactnative.dev/docs/the-new-architecture/advanced-topics-components): Various docs pages for advanced New Architecture topics have recently been published, such as using Swift or invoking native commands.
- ğŸ“œ [Profiling React Native Internals with Tracy for Peak Performance](https://www.callstack.com/blog/profiling-react-native-internals-with-tracy-for-peak-performance): Sometimes the perf bottleneck doesnâ€™t come from your app, but comes from RN itself. This unified profiling solution works across all platforms.
- ğŸ“œ [How to set React Native Core's feature flags on Android](https://andrei-calazans.com/posts/react-native-android-feature-flags/): Quick tip explaining how to turn on `enableFabricLogs` on Android.
- ğŸ“œ [You Might Not Need react-native-svg](https://blog.swmansion.com/you-might-not-need-react-native-svg-b5c65646d01f): This lib is quite flexible, but depending on the SVG, it might create very large React component trees. Many alternatives exist with different tradeoffs.
- ğŸ“œ [Creating Stunning Gradients in React Native with Skia](https://www.fabrizioduroni.it/blog/post/2025/04/02/react-native-skia-text-gradient)
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo SDK 53 beta](https://expo.dev/changelog/sdk-53-beta): The new SDK upgrades to React Native 0.79, React 19, turns the New Architecture on by default and includes a ton of new features. Weâ€™ll cover it in depth once itâ€™s stable in \~2 weeks\!
- ğŸ“¦ [FlashList 2.0 alpha](https://github.com/Shopify/flash-list/tree/new-rlv-prototype): The new version of this optimized list component is now alpha and Shopify encourages the community to try it. Rebuilt from the ground up, itâ€™s faster, leverages the New Arch, and doesnâ€™t require size estimates anymore.
- ğŸ“¦ [Radon IDE 1.5 \- Radon AI Chat, improved EAS workflow, RN 0.79](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.5.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Bottom Sheet Stepper \- Manage beautiful multi-step flows in a bottom sheet](https://github.com/mahdidavoodi7/bottom-sheet-stepper)
- ğŸ¥ [Expo \- Introduction to Expo Router Layout Files](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yh6Qlg2CYwQ): Expoâ€™s first video of a new Expo Router fundamentals tutorial series.
- ğŸ¥ [Callstack \- Why You Need React Native Enterprise Framework](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yf-UZJ84-Gk)
- ğŸ¥ [Beto \- Whatâ€™s new in Expo SDK 53: React 19, Expo UI, EAS Caching, Maps, and SQLite on Web](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uXi503z8p-g)

Reconstruit Ã  partir de zÃ©ro, il est plus rapide, tire parti de la Nouvelle Arch, et ne nÃ©cessite plus d'estimations de taille.

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}

- ğŸ‘€ [TC39 107th meeting in progress](https://github.com/tc39/agendas/blob/main/2025/04.md): Happening right now. Exciting JS proposals progressed already: Composites (stage 1, supersedes Records & Tuples), Enums (stage 1, compatible with type stripping), Upsert (stage 2.7, Map update or insert operation).
- ğŸ‘€ [SpiderMonkey \- Shipping Temporal](https://spidermonkey.dev/blog/2025/04/11/shipping-temporal.html): Firefox 139 will be the very first browser to turn on the new Temporal feature.
- ğŸ“œ [Custom CSS Functions in the Browser](https://www.oddbird.net/2025/04/11/custom-functions/): Exciting CSS feature, with a prototype now available in Chromium canary 136+.
- ğŸ“œ [How Rolldown Works: Module Loading, Dependency Graphs, and Optimization Explained](https://www.atriiy.dev/blog/rolldown-module-loader-and-dependency-graph)

- ğŸ“¦ [Bare \- Minimal JS runtime that actually runs everywhere](https://pears.com/news/introducing-bare-actually-run-javascript-everywhere/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Anime.js 4.0](https://animejs.com/): A complete rewrite of the animation library, launched with an impressive landing page.
